actionItems.text: Discuss elevated blood pressure (138/88 mmHg) - target is <130/80
actionItems.trigger: Blood pressure averaging 138/88 mmHg, above target of 130/80

actionItems.text: Review elevated resting heart rate (up 9% this week to 68 bpm)

actionItems.text: Ask about persistent dry cough - possible Lisinopril side effect
actionItems.trigger: Common side effect of Lisinopril (persistent dry cough)

actionItems.text: Discuss Lisinopril dosage adjustment based on BP readings
actionItems.trigger: BP still elevated despite current 20mg dosage

actionItems.text: Report muscle pain or weakness while taking Atorvastatin
actionItems.trigger: Age 58, male - higher risk of muscle-related side effects with statins

actionItems.text: Review kidney function (eGFR >60) - important for Metformin safety
actionItems.trigger: Age 58 - kidney function monitoring recommended for patients over 50 on Metformin

actionItems.text: Discuss Aspirin interaction with Lisinopril (may reduce BP-lowering effect)
actionItems.trigger: Medium severity drug interaction detected between Aspirin and Lisinopril

actionItems.text: Review A1C result of 6.8% - close to target of <7%

actionItems.text: Celebrate LDL improvement - down 23% to 112 mg/dL with Atorvastatin
actionItems.trigger: LDL cholesterol decreased from 145 to 112 mg/dL (23% improvement)

actionItems.text: Address poor sleep quality (down 15%) affecting heart rate and stress
actionItems.trigger: Sleep quality decreased 15% with correlated rise in resting heart rate next day
actionItems.source: AI correlation: Sleep decline → HR increase

actionItems.text: Ask about nausea from Metformin - common early side effect
actionItems.trigger: Nausea is common side effect of Metformin (likelihood: common, severity: low)

actionItems.text: Verify blood glucose trends (avg 118 mg/dL, down 5%)
actionItems.trigger: Average blood glucose down 5% - Metformin working well

diagnoses.name: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.description: A chronic condition where your body doesn't use insulin properly, leading to high blood sugar levels. Managed through diet, exercise, and medication.

latestAssessment.notes: Patient continues to do well on current Metformin regimen. Recent A1C of 6.8% demonstrates excellent glycemic control. Blood glucose averages have improved 5% over the past month per wearable data. Patient reports good medication adherence and has been mindful of carbohydrate intake. No hypoglycemic episodes reported. Will continue current treatment plan.

treatmentPlan: Continue Metformin 1000mg twice daily with meals
Maintain A1C target of <7%
Monitor blood glucose with continuous glucose monitor
Follow Mediterranean diet with controlled carbohydrate portions
Regular exercise 150 minutes per week
Quarterly A1C checks and annual comprehensive metabolic panel

criticalEvents.description: A1C 6.8% - well-controlled, down from 7.1% in September
A1C 7.1% - slightly above target, Metformin dose optimized
Type 2 Diabetes diagnosed with A1C of 8.2%, started on Metformin

diagnoses.name: Hypertension
diagnoses.description: High blood pressure - when the force of blood against artery walls is consistently too high (typically 140/90 mmHg or higher).

latestAssessment.notes: Blood pressure readings remain elevated despite Lisinopril 20mg. Patient's average BP over the past 2 weeks is 138/88 mmHg, which is above our target of <130/80. Patient reports persistent dry cough which is a known side effect of ACE inhibitors. Wearable data shows correlation between poor sleep quality and elevated morning BP readings. Plan to increase Lisinopril to 30mg and reassess in 3 weeks. If dry cough persists, may need to switch to ARB class medication.

treatmentPlan: Increase Lisinopril from 20mg to 30mg once daily
Target BP <130/80 mmHg
Daily home BP monitoring (morning and evening)
Reduce sodium intake to <2000mg per day
Address sleep quality issues to help with BP control
Follow-up appointment in 3 weeks to reassess medication efficacy
Consider medication class change if dry cough persists

criticalEvents.description: BP 142/90 - elevated despite medication, dosage increase planned
7-day average BP 138/88 mmHg - consistently above target
BP 135/85 - improved but still above goal, continued current dose
Hypertension diagnosed with BP 145/92, started on Lisinopril 10mg

diagnoses.name: Hyperlipidemia
diagnoses.description: High levels of fats (lipids) in the blood, including cholesterol and triglycerides. Can increase risk of heart disease.

latestAssessment.notes: Excellent response to Atorvastatin therapy. LDL cholesterol has decreased from 145 mg/dL to 112 mg/dL (23% reduction), moving closer to our goal of <100 mg/dL for cardiovascular risk reduction. HDL remains stable at 48 mg/dL, and triglycerides are well-controlled at 135 mg/dL. Patient denies muscle pain or weakness. Continue current statin dose and recheck lipid panel in 6 months. Encouraged patient to increase physical activity which may further improve HDL levels.

treatmentPlan: Continue Atorvastatin 40mg once daily at bedtime
Target LDL <100 mg/dL for ASCVD risk reduction
Monitor for muscle pain or weakness (statin side effect)
Increase aerobic exercise to 30+ minutes, 5 days per week
Mediterranean diet with emphasis on healthy fats
Lipid panel every 6 months
Annual liver function tests while on statin therapy

criticalEvents.description: LDL 112 mg/dL - improved 23% from baseline, approaching goal
LDL 128 mg/dL - gradual improvement on Atorvastatin 40mg
Atorvastatin increased from 20mg to 40mg for better LDL control
Hyperlipidemia diagnosed with LDL 165 mg/dL, started on Atorvastatin 20mg

medications.name: Metformin
medications.purpose: Controls blood sugar levels in Type 2 Diabetes

interactions.warning: May increase risk of low blood sugar when combined with blood pressure medications

demographicRisks.note: Kidney function should be monitored regularly in patients over 50

wearableInsights.note: Your average blood glucose is down 5% - medication is working well

conditionWarnings.note: Primary medication for your diabetes - continue as prescribed

medications.name: Lisinopril
medications.purpose: Manages high blood pressure and protects heart

interactions.warning: Aspirin may reduce the blood pressure-lowering effect of Lisinopril
interactions.whatToWatch: Monitor your blood pressure readings regularly

interactions.warning: May enhance blood sugar lowering effects

wearableInsights.note: Your average BP is 138/88, still slightly elevated - may need dosage adjustment

conditionWarnings.note: Current dosage may need adjustment based on recent BP readings

medications.name: Atorvastatin
medications.purpose: Lowers cholesterol to reduce heart disease risk

interactions.warning: Can interact with certain antibiotics and antifungals - inform all doctors you're taking this

demographicRisks.note: Higher risk of muscle-related side effects in older adults - report any muscle pain immediately

wearableInsights.note: LDL down 23% to 112 mg/dL - excellent progress with current dose
Regular activity (127 min/week) helps maximize cholesterol medication effectiveness

conditionWarnings.note: Dosage increased from 20mg to 40mg in September - monitoring shows good response

medications.name: Aspirin
medications.purpose: Prevents blood clots and reduces heart attack risk

interactions.warning: May reduce effectiveness of blood pressure medication
Significantly increases bleeding risk when combined with other blood thinners
interactions.whatToWatch: Unusual bruising, blood in stool or urine, prolonged bleeding from cuts

demographicRisks.note: Increased bleeding risk with age - take with food to reduce stomach irritation

conditionWarnings.note: Prescribed for heart disease prevention given diabetes, hypertension, and cholesterol history

events.title: Cardiology Follow-Up
events.description: Routine follow-up for hypertension management. Blood pressure readings show improvement with current medication regimen.

events.title: Comprehensive Metabolic Panel
events.description: Regular monitoring of blood glucose, kidney function, and overall metabolic health status.

jargonTerms.definition: A group of blood tests that measure various substances in your blood, including glucose, electrolytes, and kidney function markers.

events.title: Emergency Room Visit
events.description: Presented with chest pain and shortness of breath. Cardiac workup negative for acute coronary syndrome. Diagnosed with anxiety-related symptoms.

jargonTerm.definition: A protein released when heart muscle is damaged. Used to diagnose heart attacks.

events.outcome: No cardiac event detected. Recommended stress management and follow-up with primary care.

events.title: Medication Adjustment
events.description: Atorvastatin dosage increased from 20mg to 40mg to better manage cholesterol levels.

events.title: Annual Physical Examination

events.title: First Recorded Visit
